title: Hampton Roads DevFest 2026
description:
Mark your calendar for Hampton Roads DevFest 2026! This unique gathering will once again spotlight local speakers, showcasing our community's deep and diverse talent.

Hampton Roads DevFest is more than a conference; it's a tribute to our dynamic local developer community. It's an ideal platform to highlight the exceptional places to work in the Hampton Roads area, emphasizing innovative technological strides. This event caters to everyone in the tech sphere, from seasoned developers and industry veterans to emerging talents and students.

Organized by RevolutionVA, a dedicated 501(c)(3) non-profit, our mission is to advance software development education throughout Virginia. Our passion for promoting learning and growth in technology is at the heart of DevFest.

Take advantage of this unparalleled opportunity to network, learn from top industry professionals, and celebrate the remarkable achievements of our tech community. Whether you're looking to sharpen your skills, explore new career pathways, or simply immerse yourself in a community of like-minded tech enthusiasts, Hampton Roads DevFest is your destination.

Join us as we recognize and nurture the extraordinary tech talent that thrives in Hampton Roads. Let's connect, discover, and grow together at Hampton Roads DevFest 2026!

title: ISSA-HR Presents: AI Poisoning: LLM Data Poisoning 101
description:
By Kenn Jensen
Visit our [Eventbrite Page](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/issa-hr-presents-ai-poisoning-tickets-1983643092889) to **RSVP**

With over 35 years of professional experience in the IT domain, Kens background spans programming, database and web development, call center technology and consulting, emergency services management solutions, automation, as well as enterprise security web filtering and enterprise network discovery and monitoring. By day, Ken works as a senior infrastructure engineer. By night, OSINT for good and AI experimenting and red teaming.

This talk breaks down LLM data poisoning in plain English, explaining how attackers can intentionally introduce misleading or malicious data during training or fine-tuning so a model learns the wrong patterns. You’ll see how even small amounts of manipulated data can influence outputs, create blind spots, or quietly weaken the reliability of AI-driven tools that organizations depend on every day.
We’ll walk through the most common entry points where poisoning can occur, including third-party datasets, user-generated inputs, and automated data pipelines. The session will also highlight real-world implications for security teams, from trust erosion and decision risk to operational and compliance concerns. Attendees will leave with a practical understanding of the guardrails organizations use to reduce risk, including data validation practices, monitoring strategies, and governance approaches that help keep AI systems trustworthy and resilient.
group: Information Systems Security Association ISSA Hampton Roads

previousVersion.title: ISSA-HR Presents: AI Poisoning: How Data Manipulation Undermines AI

title: Free OPEN Passes to DeveloperWeek 2026
description:
The Williamsburg Software Developers Group is serving as a Community Partner to [DeveloperWeek 2026](https://www.developerweek.com/). Our logo is posted on the [Community Partners](https://www.developerweek.com/community/partners/) web page. Our members are eligible for free OPEN passes to the conference.

The in-person conference in San Jose, CA is February 18-20. The virtual conference, [DeveloperWeek Global](https://www.developerweek.com/global/), is March 4. The [website ](https://www.developerweek.com/global/)and schedule for the virtual conference are still under development. Note that times on the web site are listed in Pacific time, so add three hours for our time.

Register now to get your free OPEN Pass ($195 value). You must register at the link below (and not just indicate that you are attending here on Meetup):

https://link.devnetwork.com/XZ23isaA

title: (CS)²AI Online™ Symposium: Mobilizing for Cyber Incident Mgmnt-ICS4ICS & CR-ISAC
description:
Register here to catch this constellation of stellar SMEs and thought leaders:
https://events.zoom.us/ev/AtOaWF4tLEtLgjBW7B8ToC0vrZl6tjff3-qWtL9dID_MfRINcnQo\~AgS-SPGRhEzL6loLDYYK5OqiygGF6yxylhCIfBD0MQ6PDbFQ2DxcRG6geiK_5oX3o5ICx9Z-KpdmAbTFmF0Q9jKCJg

**Do you have cyber skills and want to make a real impact?**
If you’ve ever wondered how the private sector could be better leveraged during major cyber incidents—or how *you* could play a meaningful role—this event was built for you.
We are at a critical turning point. Incredible cyber capabilities exist across the private sector, government, and nonprofit communities, yet we still lack a unified framework to mobilize them effectively at scale. That changes now.

**Join us for a first‑of‑its‑kind experience focused on building a common Incident Command System (ICS) for cyber response through Civilian Reserve ISAC.**

At this event, you will:
· **Learn exactly how ICS can transform your cyber response approach**—and finally bridge the coordination gap between companies, government, and critical infrastructure partners.
· **Discover how to earn nationally recognized credentials**, preparing you to contribute confidently during real-world cyber incidents.
· **Engage directly with CR‑ISAC leadership**, the team building a nationwide civilian cyber reserve capable of supporting federal surge operations when it matters most.
· **Gain clarity, connection, and mission-ready skills** that allow you to step off the sidelines and into the arena.
If you're feeling the urgency to get trained, get involved, and stand ready to help your community and country during a major cyber event—**don’t miss this**.

**Be part of the movement to build cyber resilience. Your skills matter. Your participation matters. The time is now.**

AGENDA
• 11:30a-12p - Intro and framing presentation
o Megan Samford
o Claire Daniel, President of ISA
• 12-1p - Govt angle on incident management using incident command system panel
o Corrigan, Tristan M (Navy)
o Mark McClellan (Air Force)
o Jon Huddleston (USACE)
• 1-2p - Private sector application of incident command system panel
o Chuck Weissenborn (Dragos)
o Chris Sistrunk (Mandiant)
• 2-3p - Framing of the future panel – what can be done in the USA, EU, MEA, Asia, etc to create global incident management structures
o Mark Montgomery (Foundation for Defense of Democracies)
o Bryson Bort (SCYTHE, ICS Village, GRIMM)
o Vic Macias (USAF, UMGC, CR-ISAC)

**Do you have cyber skills and want to make a real impact when your country needs you most?**
If you’ve ever wondered how the private sector could be better leveraged during major cyber incidents—or how *you* could play a meaningful role—this event was built for you.
**The U.S. and its allies** are at a critical turning point. Incredible cyber capabilities exist across the private sector, government, and nonprofit communities, yet we still lack a unified framework to mobilize them effectively at scale. That changes now.
**Join us for a first‑of‑its‑kind experience focused on building a common Incident Command System (ICS) for cyber response through Civilian Reserve ISAC.**
At this event, you will:
· **Learn exactly how ICS can transform your cyber response approach**—and finally bridge the coordination gap between companies, government, and critical infrastructure partners.
· **Discover how to earn nationally recognized credentials**, preparing you to contribute confidently during real-world cyber incidents.
· **Engage directly with CR‑ISAC leadership**, the team building a nationwide civilian cyber reserve capable of supporting federal surge operations when it matters most.
· **Gain clarity, connection, and mission-ready skills** that allow you to step off the sidelines and into the arena.
If you're feeling the urgency to get trained, get involved, and stand ready to help your community and country during a major cyber event—**don’t miss this**.
**Be part of the movement to build America’s cyber resilience. Your skills matter. Your participation matters. The time is now.**

Seats are limited - Register now!
https://events.zoom.us/ev/AtOaWF4tLEtLgjBW7B8ToC0vrZl6tjff3-qWtL9dID_MfRINcnQo\~AgS-SPGRhEzL6loLDYYK5OqiygGF6yxylhCIfBD0MQ6PDbFQ2DxcRG6geiK_5oX3o5ICx9Z-KpdmAbTFmF0Q9jKCJg
\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
Becoming a paid member is quick and easy (and helps us keep offering these educational opportunities!). Please join now! [[[https://www.cs2ai.org/plans-pricing](https://www.cs2ai.org/plans-pricing)](https://www.cs2ai.org/plans-pricing)]([https://www.cs2ai.org/plans-pricing](https://www.cs2ai.org/plans-pricing)]([https://www.cs2ai.org/plans-pricing](https://www.cs2ai.org/plans-pricing)))
All past seminars and symposiums are available to paid [CS2AI.ORG](http://cs2ai.org/) members. Check out the Resources area of our website in the Members Portal [[[https://www.cs2ai.org/](https://www.cs2ai.org/)](https://www.cs2ai.org/)]([https://www.cs2ai.org/](https://www.cs2ai.org/)]([https://www.cs2ai.org/](https://www.cs2ai.org/)))

Certificates for Professional Development/Continuing Education Units (PDUs/CEUs) are available for all registered individuals who attend at least one hour of the event.[[https://www.cs2ai.org/get-involved](https://www.cs2ai.org/get-involved)](https://www.cs2ai.org/get-involved)]([https://www.cs2ai.org/get-involved](https://www.cs2ai.org/get-involved)]([https://www.cs2ai.org/get-involved](https://www.cs2ai.org/get-involved)))

\*Please note that (CS)²AI Online™ events are provided free of charge as educational career development content through the support of our paid members and the generous contributions of our corporate Strategic Alliance Partners. Contact information used in registering for our directly supported seminars may be shared with sponsors funding those specific events. Unless noted on our Zoom Event registration page, all events are open for direct funding support.
© Control System Cyber Security Association International 2026

title: Late Night Coders
description:
Can't sleep? Stay up all night coding? Or can't make the usual meetups till the kids are in bed?

Late Night Coders is a meetup for the rest of us.

Let's get together and share what we're working on, co-work, or get help on any problems we're running into. Some code challenge keeping you up? Bring it to us!

Anyone is welcome at any experience or sleep-deprivation level. Bring your laptop! Or just come hang out with cool people.

Turned off guest options, bring whoever is interested in coming.

title: WSDG March Technical Presentation
description:
Highlights from DeveloperWeek Global
by Glover Barker

Abstract:
DeveloperWeek Global is a virtual Software Development & AI Engineering Conference being held on March 4. Some of the highlights from this conference will be presented.

Bio:
Glover Barker is a retired Software Architect. His background includes software development in C++, Python, and various other languages. He has also worked in management, requirements, design, testing, quality assurance, and configuration management. Past companies include ivWatch, NASA contractors, Symantec, R. R. Donnelley, Reuters, and AT&T Bell Laboratories.
\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
This hybrid meeting will be available both in-person and remotely. For those attending in person, we will be at the Williamsburg Regional Library, Conference Room B.
For online access, the Zoom info is:
[https://us06web.zoom.us/j/2562166096?omn=89638798242](https://us06web.zoom.us/j/2562166096?omn=89638798242)
Meeting ID: 256 216 6096

title: Cybersecurity - Chesapeake Weekend Afternoon Networking (WAN)
description:
**Attention Information Security and Cybersecurity Professionals!**
Are you looking to meet new people who share your interests? Whether you're thinking about entering cybersecurity, have recently entered the field, or are a seasoned professional, we welcome all to join us for an evening of networking, learning, and fun.
**Why Attend?**
Enjoy a night out at the cozy and welcoming **Neat Bird** in Chesapeake, where you can connect with like-minded individuals. We love bringing people together to share insights and build lasting connections. Join us for some beers—or not, if that's your preference. Our goal is to help you forge meaningful relationships in the cybersecurity community.
**About ISSA-HR**
The Information Systems Security Association of Hampton Roads (ISSA-HR) hosts social events throughout the region, providing a space for cybersecurity professionals and enthusiasts to get together, share stories, learn new information, and meet new people. With years of cybersecurity expertise, ISSA-HR is committed to promoting the industry and nurturing the next generation of cybersecurity professionals.

**RSVP now and bring a friend!** We look forward to seeing you there!

**Location:** Neat Bird, 565 Belaire Ave, Chesapeake, VA 23320
Time: **6:00 - 8:00 PM**
group: Information Systems Security Association ISSA Hampton Roads

title: Brian Knox: Stop Rewriting DAX: User-Defined Functions & the DAX Lib Ecosystem
description:
**IN PERSON MEETING!!!!!**
For years, DAX developers have lived with a dirty secret: copy-paste is our version control. Complex measures get duplicated across models, tweaked slightly, and inevitably drift out of sync. Calculation groups helped, but they came with their own complexity and limitations. This session takes you from zero to productive with User-Defined Functions. Introduced in September 2025, UDFs let you write reusable, parameterized functions in DAX for the first time and DAX Lib (daxlib.org) gives you 30+ community-built function packages to import and use immediately. This session walks through UDF fundamentals, live imports from DAX Lib, and practical examples of replacing duplicated measure logic with clean, maintainable function calls.
group: Hampton Roads SQL Server User Group

title: 10 Years A Kotlin Dev
description:
Kotlin has emerged as a compelling choice for both Android and backend development, offering a modern language with strong null-safety, concise syntax, and excellent interoperability with Java. In this meetup, we'll explore the key advantages that drive teams to adopt Kotlin—from improved developer productivity and safer Android apps to structured concurrency with coroutines on the backend. We'll highlight how Kotlin aligns with today's Android ecosystem, integrates with popular backend frameworks, and enables cleaner, more maintainable code across platforms. At the same time, adopting Kotlin is not without challenges. We'll take an honest look at the tradeoffs, including learning curve considerations, build performance, interoperability friction with legacy Java code, and operational concerns in backend systems. Through a retrospective lens, this talk will share practical lessons learned and guidance on when Kotlin is the right choice—and when it may not be—helping attendees make informed decisions for their Android and server-side projects.

This is a Hybrid event, you can also attend virtually using this link: https://discord.gg/nUSHDN2J2T
Once in the Discord Server, go to the voice chat named "Meeting Room"

Agenda:
6:30 PM: Doors open
7:00 PM: Main Event
8:00 PM Questions and Social Time

title: Norfolk Cybersecurity Networking & Happy Hour
description:
From 6-9pm for a night of networking and fun at The OV Beach Tavern located in Ocean View, Norfolk. Happy hour is till 8pm with fantastic deals, check the 2nd image for details.

Connect with fellow tech enthusiasts, Information Security, and Cybersecurity professionals in a relaxed atmosphere. Share ideas, make new friends, and enjoy delicious drinks and snacks. Don't miss out on this opportunity to expand your professional circle and have a great time!

Free tickets and further details are available at:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/1980179496178
group: Information Systems Security Association ISSA Hampton Roads

title: Cybersecurity Social/Happy Hour meetup for networking, meeting new people
description:
Information Security and Cybersecurity professionals, come out and meet some new people. Have a night out on the town. Meet new people with similar interests. We love connecting with people who have similar interests. Whether you thinking about entering cybersecurity, recently entered, or seasoned, we welcome all to come out and drink some beers with us, or not drink with us. We want to meet you, to meet new people. We had enough of the virtual world with covid. Lets get back out and start meeting people again.

The Information Systems Security Association of Hampton Roads (ISSA-HR) is setting up social events throughout Hampton Roads to give Cyber Security Professionals and those interested in the subject a place to: Get Together, Share Stories, Learn Information, Meet New People.
I﻿SSA-HR has years of Cyber Security knowledge that we are happy to give. Our organization is here to promote Cyber Security and bring up the next generation of Cyber Security Professionals.

Location: **The Casual Pint**: 3380 Princess Anne Rd, Ste 111, Virginia Beach, VA 23456
Time: **6:00 - 8:00 PM**
group: Information Systems Security Association ISSA Hampton Roads

title: Geeks at a Bar- Peninsula Happy Hour
description:
Do you work with technology or for a tech company? Do you speak geek? Come network with other technology industry workers for a casual, conversational happy hour.

This meetup is loosely organized, but very consistently scheduled. If you want to meet up somewhere else, share it in the #peninsula channel at 757dev.org Slack, or in the comments.

title: John Sterrett- Advanced Data Protection Strategies with Azure SQL
description:
**IN PERSON MEETING!!!!! (PLEASE NOTE DATE CHANGE FOR THIS MEETING ONLY)**
Organizations handle increasing amounts of growth with their sensitive data. Data engineers must protect their data from external attackers, application users, and even privileged employees like database administrators.

This session will teach you how to protect your data while maintaining functionality and performance. You will leave this session knowing how and why column-level encryption, row-level security, and auditing are keys to securing your data.

9/4/24 - Bitcoin through memetic bell curves
7/3/24 - Hayek
6/5/24 - Presentation on preparing for, surviving and embracing volatility

title: Kevin Feasel- Data Virtualization in SQL Server
description:
**IN PERSON MEETING!!!!!**
SQL Server's data virtualization stack has evolved throughout the past decade, allowing you to integrate SQL Server with a variety of external systems, such as Oracle, MongoDB, Cosmos DB, Azure Blob Storage, and AWS S3. In this talk, we will briefly cover the history of data virtualization in SQL Server and focus on how we can write T-SQL queries to access data from heterogeneous sources, both in SQL Server 2025 and in prior versions. Finally, we will look at several interesting use cases for data virtualization in the modern data environment.
group: Hampton Roads SQL Server User Group

title: Joey D'antoni- SQL Server 2025 Deep Dive: Essential Innovations for DBAs & Devs
description:
**IN PERSON MEETING!!!!!**
SQL Server 2025 is the AI database for enterprises. But there are more new things than just AI—in this demo filled, full-day workshop, you will learn about:

• Engine improvements that make everything just run faster
• How SQL Server 2025 helps you operate more securely
• Further enhancements to high availability
• Building event-driven architectures with change event streaming

Master the benefits of the latest release of SQL Server and how to deploy it in your organization.
group: Hampton Roads SQL Server User Group
